venue.name: Villa Victoria Center for ht eArts

item.description:
Back in June of last year, John organized a meet up to see the LTAB documentary about this program that has grown to a resounding success in Chicago. Well MASSL.E.A.P. Collective has taken this program under their wing and have organized it's happening for our youth here in Massachusetts.

I am organizing to see the first competition together.

2012 LOUDER THAN A BOMB MASSACHUSETTS
FINALS SHOWCASE
at the beautiful
VILLA VICTORIA CENTER FOR THE ARTS
Tickets are now available on-line at
BROWN PAPER TICKETS!

A limited number of general admission tickets for finals showcase are being released to the public at this time. Participants and a local area high school students will be admitted for free (on a first come first serve basis). A select number of “day of” tickets will also be made available before the show. Our overall event capacity is limited, so please make your arrangements, buy tickets as soon as possible to ensure that you’re going to have a seat to the launch of this youth movement in Massachusetts!

What is Louder Than A Bomb (LTAB)?
Louder Than A Bomb was started in 2001 in Chicago by poets Anna West and Kevin Coval. It’s since grown to be the largest teen poetry festival in the world, and even inspired a full-length feature film.

The mission? “Aiming to bring teens together across racial, gang, and socio-economic lines, LTAB is a friendly competition that emphasizes self-expression and community via poetry, oral story-telling, and hip-hop spoken word.”

This Spring 2012, Mass LEAP celebrates the creation of the very first Louder Than A Bomb festival in Massachusetts.

Since this is a Friday night and may be difficult to meet afterward, I thought we could gather at Flour Bakery beforehand as early as 5:00.  Let me know if you can meet there.  Otherwise, I can plan to be in front of the center until 6:40 pm.  I would like to leave open the option of going out afterwards.  

Flour is a 5 minute walk and it is located:

1595 Washington Street
Boston

Hope to see you at the Festival..

Diane
item.name: Louder Than a Bomb - Massachusetts (Redux and In-Person)
